fields.text: Quare fremuerunt gentes, et populi meditati sunt inania?
fields.translation: Why do the heathen so furiously rage together: and why do the people imagine a vain thing?

fields.text: Astiterunt reges terrae, et principes convenerunt in unum adversus Dominum, et adversus christum eius.
fields.translation: The kings of the earth stand up, and the rulers take counsel together: against the Lord, and against his Anointed.

fields.text: Dirumpamus vincula eorum, et proiciamus a nobis iugum ipsorum.
fields.translation: Let us break their bonds asunder: and cast away their cords from us.

fields.text: Qui habitat in caelis irridebit eos, et Dominus subsannabit eos.
fields.translation: He that dwelleth in heaven shall laugh them to scorn : the Lord shall have them in derision.

fields.text: Tunc loquetur ad eos in ira sua, et in furore suo conturbabit eos.
fields.translation: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath: and vex them in his sore displeasure.

fields.text: Ego autem constitutus sum rex ab eo super Sion, montem sanctum eius, praedicans praeceptum eius.
fields.translation: Yet have I set my King: upon my holy hill of Sion.

fields.text: Dominus dixit ad me: Filius meus es tu; ego hodie genui te.
fields.translation: I will preach the law, whereof the Lord hath said unto me: Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.

fields.text: Postula a me, et dabo tibi gentes haereditatem tuam, et possessionem tuam terminos terrae.
fields.translation: Desire of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance: and the utmost parts of the earth for thy possession.

fields.text: Reges eos in virga ferrea, et tamquam vas figuli confringes eos.
fields.translation: Thou shalt bruise them with a rod of iron: and break them in pieces like a potter's vessel.
Be wise now therefore, O ye kings:
be learned, ye that are judges of the earth.

fields.text: Servite Domino in timore, et exsultate ei cum tremore.
fields.translation: Serve the Lord in fear: and rejoice unto him with reverence.

fields.text: Apprehendite disciplinam, nequando irascatur Dominus, et pereatis de via iusta.
fields.translation: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and so ye perish from the right way:

fields.text: Cum exarserit in brevi ira eius, beati omnes qui confidunt in eo.
fields.translation: if his wrath be kindled, (yea, but a little,) blessed are all they that put their trust in him.

fields.text: Patrem omnipotentem, factorem caeli et terrae, visibilium omnium, et invisibilium.
Et in unum Dominum Iesum Christum, Filium Dei unigenitum.
Et ex Patre natum ante omnia saecula.
Deum de Deo, lumen de lumine, Deum verum de Deo vero.
Qui propter non homines, et propter nostram salutem descendit de caelis.
Et incarnatus est de Spiritu Sancto ex Maria Virgine:
sub Pontio Pilato passus, et sepultus est.
Et resurrexit tertia die, secundum Scripturas.
Et iterum venturus est cum gloria, iudicare vivos et mortuos:
Et in Spiritum Sanctum, Dominum, et vivificantem:
Qui cum Patre et Filio simul adoratur, et glorificatur:
Et unam sanctam catholicam et apostolicam Ecclesiam.
Confiteor unum baptisma in remissionem peccatorum.

fields.translation: Come, bride of Christ,
receive the crown
which the Lord
has prepared for you for all eternity.
I’m broke,
Because I lost my friend.
He left me, now I'm alone,

fields.text: Pleine de pleurs et de souci.
fields.translation: Full of tears and sorrow.
Nightingale in the woods
Go immediately

fields.text: Va t’en dire à mon ami
fields.translation: And tell my friend
That I’m tormented for his sake.

fields.text: Quo abiit dilectus tuus, o pulcherrima mulierum?
Dilectus meus descendit in hortum suum ut pascatur in hortis suis et lilia colligat.
Qualis est dilectus tuus, o pulcherrima mulierum?
Sicut malus inter lingua silvarum, sic dilectus meus inter filias.
En dilectus meus loquitur mihi surge propera amica mea, columba mea, formosa mea et veni
per te usque in finem ei complaceamus.
ideo ne despicias quia ore indigno
Sancta Dei genitrix, ora pro nobis.
Sancta Virgo virginum, intercede pro nobis.
Par deux vieillards convoitant sa beauté
Fut en son cœur triste et déconfortée
Voyant l'effort fait à sa chasteté.
Elle leur dit : si par déloyauté
De ce corps mien vous avez jouissance,
C'est fait de moi ! Si je fais résistance,
Vous me ferez mourir en déshonneur :
Mais j'aime mieux périr en innocence
Que d'offenser par péché le Seigneur.
Pleni sunt caeli et terra gloria tua.
Benedictus qui venit in nomine Domini.
Je n’en puis plus durer, Marquet, allons y donc.
Marquet aussy Marquette, en gardant leurs moutons,
S’assirent sur l’herbette, auprès d'ung vert buisson.
Je n’en puis plus durer, Marquet, allons y donc.
Lors la fillette a dict, en baisant son mignon,
Regardez près de nous le beau lict de saison.
Je n’en puis plus durer, Marquet, allons y donc.
Te Deus Pater, ut Dei Mater
Per tuum responsum *datum [*gratum in some voices]
Si bona suscepimus de manu Domini,
fields.translation: If we have received good things from the hand of the Lord,
why should we not endure bad things?
The Lord has given, the Lord has taken away;

fields.text: sicut Domino placuit, ita factum est:
fields.translation: as it has pleased the Lord, so is it done:
blessed be the name of the Lord.

fields.text: Nudus egressus sum de utero/ventris matris meae, et nudus revertar illuc.
fields.translation: Naked came I out of my mother’s womb, and naked shall I return there.
The Lord has given, the Lord has taken away;

fields.text: sicut Domino placuit, ita factum est:
fields.translation: as it has pleased the Lord, so is it done:
blessed be the name of the Lord.

fields.text: Et sicut dies verni circumdabant eam
Quae est ista quae processit quasi aurora consurbens,

fields.translation: Kiss me, my sweetheart,

fields.text: Par amour, je vous en prie.
fields.translation: As my true love, I beg you
Indeed I will not!
And why?
If I were foolish,
My mother might be hurt.
That's why!

fields.text: Et in terra pax hominibus bonae volumptatis.
Gratias agimus tibi propter magnam gloriam tuam.
Domine Deus, Rex caelestis, Deus Pater omnipotens.
Domine Deus, Agnus Dei, Filius Patris.
Qui tollis peccata mundi, miserere nobis.
Qui tollis peccata mundi, suscipe deprecationem nostram.
Qui sedes ad dexteram Patris, miserere nobis.
Cum Sancto Spiritu, in gloria Dei Patris.
Tota pulchra es, amica mea, et macula non est in te.
Veni de Libano, sponsa mea, veni de Libano, veni, coronaberis.
Vulnerasti cor meum, soror mea, sponsa; vulnerasti cor meum in uno oculorum tuorum, et in uno crine colli tui.
Favus distillans labia tua, sponsa, mel et lac sub lingua tua, et odor vestimentorum tuorum sicut odor thuris.
Te Deus Pater, ut Dei Mater

fields.translation: One day, Susanne's love was solicited

fields.text: Par deux vieillards convoitant sa beauté
fields.translation: By two old men coveting her beauty.

fields.text: Fut en son cœur triste et déconfortée
fields.translation: She became sad and discomforted at heart,

fields.text: Voyant l'effort fait à sa chasteté.
fields.translation: Seeing the attempt on her chastity.

fields.text: Elle leur dit : si par déloyauté
fields.translation: She said to them: 'If disloyally

fields.text: De ce corps mien vous avez jouissance,
fields.translation: From my body you take pleasure,

fields.text: C'est fait de moi ! Si je fais résistance,
fields.translation: This is done to me! If I resist,

fields.text: Vous me ferez mourir en déshonneur :
fields.translation: You would make me die in disgrace:

fields.text: Mais j'aime mieux périr en innocence
fields.translation: But I would rather perish in innocence,

fields.text: Que d'offenser par péché le Seigneur.
fields.translation: Than offend the Lord by sin.

fields.text: Voulant honneur, que de vous je m'absente,
Ne vous puis faire apparoir mon désir,
Mais le bon Dieu, si de mort il m'exempte
M'en donnera quelque jour le loisir.
Et quand la mort viendroit ce corps saysir,
L'esprit qui sent toujours son amour croistre,
D'aller au ciel, ne prendroit point plaisir,
Sans vous l'avoir en terre faict congnoistre
D'aller au ciel, ne prendroit point plaisir,
Sans vous l'avoir en terre faict congnoistre.
Agnus Dei, qui tollis peccata mundi:
Agnus Dei, qui tollis peccata mundi:
Agnus Dei, qui tollis peccata mundi:
O gente brunette que Dieu gard,
À mon aise en ma chambrette.
Tu y viendrois tous les jours.
O gente brunette que Dieu gard,
À mon aise en ma chambrette.

fields.translation: Blessed you are, queen of heaven,
And ruler of the whole world,
And medicine for the sick.
You are called brightest star of the sea,
Who give birth to the sun of clemency,
By whom you are illuminated.

fields.text: Te Deus Pater, ut Dei Mater
fields.translation: God the Father, that you might become
God's Mother and he God's Father,
Whose daughter she was,
Sanctified you, kept you sacred,
And sent you this greeting:
Hail, full of grace.
Through that spoken "Hail"
And your pleasing response
The Word became flesh from you,
By whom all are saved.
Now, Mother, implore your son,
That he may take away our guilt,
And may give us the kingdom prepared
In the celestial fatherland.
Amen.
Lord, have mercy.
Christ, have mercy.
Lord, have mercy.

fields.text: Et in terra pax hominibus bonae voluntatis.
fields.translation: And in earth peace to men of good will.
We praise thee.
We bless thee.
We worship thee.
We glorify thee.

fields.text: Gratias agimus tibi propter magnam gloriam tuam.
fields.translation: We give thanks to thee for thy great glory.

fields.text: Domine Deus, Rex caelestis, Deus Pater omnipotens.
fields.translation: Lord God, Heavenly King, God the Father Almighty.
Lord Jesus Christ, the only begotten Son.

fields.text: Domine Deus, Agnus Dei, Filius Patris.
fields.translation: Lord God, Lamb of God, Son of the Father.

fields.text: Qui tollis peccata mundi, miserere nobis.
fields.translation: Thou that takest away the sins of the world, have mercy upon us.

fields.text: Qui tollis peccata mundi, suscipe deprecationem nostram.
fields.translation: Thou that takest away the sins of the world, receive our prayer.

fields.text: Qui sedes ad dexteram Patris, miserere nobis.
fields.translation: Thou that sittest at the right hand of the Father, have mercy upon us.
For thou only art holy.
Thou only art the Lord.
Thou only art the most high, Jesus Christ.

fields.text: Cum Sancto Spiritu, in gloria Dei Patris.
fields.translation: With the Holy Ghost, in the glory of God the Father.
Amen.

fields.text: Patrem omnipotentem, factorem caeli et terrae, visibilium omnium, et invisibilium.
fields.translation: The Father almighty, maker of heaven and earth, and of all things visible and invisible.

fields.text: Et in unum Dominum Iesum Christum, Filium Dei unigenitum.
fields.translation: And in one Lord Jesus Christ, the only begotten Son of God.

fields.text: Et ex Patre natum ante omnia saecula.
fields.translation: Begotten of the Father before all worlds.

fields.text: Deum de Deo, lumen de lumine, Deum verum de Deo vero.
fields.translation: God of God, light of light, true God of true God.
Begotten, not made, being of one substance with the Father.
by whom all things were made.

fields.text: Qui propter non homines, et propter nostram salutem descendit de caelis.
fields.translation: Who for us men and for our salvation came down from heaven.

fields.text: Et incarnatus est de Spiritu Sancto ex Maria Virgine:
fields.translation: And was incarnate by the Holy Ghost of the Virgin Mary.
And was made man.
He was crucified also for us:

fields.text: sub Pontio Pilato passus, et sepultus est.
fields.translation: he suffered under Pontius Pilate, and was buried.

fields.text: Et resurrexit tertia die, secundum Scripturas.
fields.translation: And on the third day He rose again, according to the Scriptures.
And ascended into heaven:
he sitteth at the right hand of the Father.

fields.text: Et iterum venturus est cum gloria, iudicare vivos et mortuos:
fields.translation: And He shall come again with glory, to judge the living and the dead:
whose kingdom shall have no end.

fields.text: Et in Spiritum Sanctum, Dominum, et vivificantem:
fields.translation: And in the Holy Ghost, the Lord and giver of life:
who prodeedeth from the Father and the Son.

fields.text: Qui cum Patre et Filio simul adoratur, et conglorificatur:
fields.translation: Who with the Father and the Son together is worshipped and glorified:
who spake by the Prophets.

fields.text: Et unam sanctam catholicam et apostolicam Ecclesiam.
fields.translation: And in one holy catholic and apostolic Church.

fields.text: Confiteor unum baptisma in remissionem peccatorum.
fields.translation: I acknowledge one Baptism for the remission of sins.
And I look for the resurrection of the dead.
And the life of the world to come.
Amen.
Holy, holy, holy, Lord God of Hosts.

fields.text: Pleni sunt caeli et terra gloria tua.
fields.translation: Heaven and earth are full of thy glory.
Hosanna in the highest.

fields.text: Benedictus qui venit in nomine Domini.

fields.translation: Thou that takest away the sins of the world, have mercy upon us.

fields.text: Qui tollis peccata mundi, suscipe deprecationem nostram.
fields.translation: Thou that takest away the sins of the world, receive our prayer.

fields.text: Qui sedes ad dexteram Patris, miserere nobis.
fields.translation: Thou that sittest at the right hand of the Father, have mercy upon us.
For thou only art holy.
Thou only art the Lord.
Thou only art the most high, Jesus Christ.

fields.text: Cum Sancto Spiritu, in gloria Dei Patris.
fields.translation: With the Holy Ghost, in the glory of God the Father.
Amen.

fields.text: Patrem omnipotentem, factorem caeli et terrae, visibilium omnium, et invisibilium.
fields.translation: The Father almighty, maker of heaven and earth, and of all things visible and invisible.

fields.text: Et in unum Dominum Iesum Christum, Filium Dei unigenitum.
fields.translation: And in one Lord Jesus Christ, the only begotten Son of God.

fields.text: Et ex Patre natum ante omnia saecula.
fields.translation: Begotten of the Father before all worlds.

fields.text: Deum de Deo, lumen de lumine, Deum verum de Deo vero.
fields.translation: God of God, light of light, true God of true God.
Begotten, not made, being of one substance with the Father.
by whom all things were made.

fields.text: Qui propter non homines, et propter nostram salutem descendit de caelis.
fields.translation: Who for us men and for our salvation came down from heaven.

fields.text: Et incarnatus est de Spiritu Sancto ex Maria Virgine:
fields.translation: And was incarnate by the Holy Ghost of the Virgin Mary.
And was made man.
He was crucified also for us:

fields.text: sub Pontio Pilato passus, et sepultus est.
fields.translation: he suffered under Pontius Pilate, and was buried.

fields.text: Et resurrexit tertia die, secundum Scripturas.
fields.translation: And on the third day He rose again, according to the Scriptures.
And ascended into heaven:
he sitteth at the right hand of the Father.

fields.text: Et iterum venturus est cum gloria, iudicare vivos et mortuos:
fields.translation: And He shall come again with glory, to judge the living and the dead:
whose kingdom shall have no end.

fields.text: Et in Spiritum Sanctum, Dominum, et vivificantem:
fields.translation: And in the Holy Ghost, the Lord and giver of life:
who prodeedeth from the Father and the Son.

fields.text: Qui cum Patre et Filio simul adoratur, et conglorificatur:
fields.translation: Who with the Father and the Son together is worshipped and glorified:
who spake by the Prophets.

fields.text: Et unam sanctam catholicam et apostolicam Ecclesiam.
fields.translation: And in one holy catholic and apostolic Church.

fields.text: Confiteor unum baptisma in remissionem peccatorum.
fields.translation: I acknowledge one Baptism for the remission of sins.
And I look for the resurrection of the dead.
And the life of the world to come.
Amen.
Holy, holy, holy, Lord God of Hosts.

fields.text: Pleni sunt caeli et terra gloria tua.
fields.translation: Heaven and earth are full of thy glory.
Hosanna in the highest.

fields.text: Benedictus qui venit in nomine Domini.
fields.translation: Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord.

fields.text: Agnus Dei, qui tollis peccata mundi:
fields.translation: Lamb of God, that takest away the sins of the world:
have mercy upon us.

fields.text: Agnus Dei, qui tollis peccata mundi:
fields.translation: Lamb of God, that takest away the sins of the world:
grant us thy peace.
Lord, have mercy.
Christ, have mercy.
Lord, have mercy.

fields.text: Et in terra pax hominibus bonae voluntatis.
fields.translation: And in earth peace to men of good will.
We praise thee.
We bless thee.
We worship thee.
We glorify thee.

fields.text: Gratias agimus tibi propter magnam gloriam tuam.
fields.translation: We give thanks to thee for thy great glory.

fields.text: del maggior rivo alle superbi sponde
ove a l’ombra di liet’e verdi fronde
s’accoglie la cagion de miei martiri.
E se qualche pietà vi par l’inspiri
che d’ogni intorno ne risonin l’onde
et ella insieme forse ne sospiri,
ditele ch’io men vo come al ciel piace
lontan da lei e con si cruda doglia
che già null’altr’a questa può aguagliarsi.
Fugg’ogni gioia e resta chi mi sface
onde non sia che ritornar non voglia
tosto che più benign’il ciel suol farsi.
onde non sia che ritornar non voglia
tosto che più benign’il ciel suol farsi.
Et in terra pax hominibus bonae voluntatis.

Il me suffit de tous mes maulx.

Que fault il que ie face.
De douleur min cuceúr se est mort.
